definition: to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: A wilful child in my heart never accept hia grow-up.
sentences.chinese: 的小孩，賭氣着，不肯承認長大的事實。

sentences.english: Maybe she just went away in a fit of pique, when she is not angry,she will be back.
sentences.chinese: 或許她只是一時賭氣出走，等她氣消了自然會回來的。

sentences.english: He left in a fit of pique, demonstrating that he was treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 他一賭氣就走了，一邊抗議他被不公平的對待。

sentences.english: The child took sulks, and would not eat.

definition: to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to be in a tangle/to nag
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
